ratings.comment: Dr. Spiegelman was very charming and had interesting lectures, but simply moved at way too fast of a pace. Copying down his powerpoints were next to impossible and made it difficult to process any of the information. He rarely clarified difficult topics and acted annoyed when questions were asked. Mandatory lecture quizzes each week were tough.

He is a very knowledgeable and intelligent professor but he simply moves at a rapid pace. If you can keep up with a Russian accent he's great if not read your book and take notes before lecture. Good stories and great at clarifying If you ask him after class or during office hours. 5/5 if he would slow down just a bit.

He makes it impossible to take notes during lecture. Most of his powerpoint slides are complicated pictures from the book. There are some with text, but he flies through them so quickly that it's impossible to read it all, let alone write anything down. I've had to learn pretty much everything on my own from the textbook.

Everyone says he's a bad lecturer but I disagree. All of his powerpoints are pictures from the book and animations which are good visuals and he explains them well. Strong accent but you'll catch on.He is also VERY sexy, and class is interesting. SO yes its mandatory but you will WANT to go to class, I sure did.
Useless yet mandatory lecture.  Enjoy having a professor who cares so little about teaching that he doesn't even make the test.

He was a pretty decent professor. I admit he had a pretty strong accent but it wasn't incomprehensible.  Showed short videos during slides to help with understanding and was funny at times.  As long as you read the book you should be able to get through genetics.

hes foreign and really doesnt teach much of anything. all of his lectures consist of him talking really fast while no one knows what hes saying. all of the images are straight from the book...so just read it because he doesnt help at all. didnt hold a review session for the exam and it was pretty tough. good luck if you have him.

yea about that...taught genetics and read off slides entire time. just mubles through his lectures and the test was HARD. average was about a 77 or so. may be better next time around, but expect to read the book to understand everything.

yea about that...taught genetics and read off slides entire time. just mubles through his lectures and the test was HARD. average was about a 77 or so. may be better next time around, but expect to read the book to understand everything.
Horrible teacher, accent (not understandable), reads off the slides

Could barely understand him most of the time because of his accent. Mainly just stood at the podium and read off slides. Also, he was not very helpful- when asked questions he would often not even answer the question at all. It was his first time teaching I think and I would suspect he would be better next time around.
He's a quiet guy, but I liked the way he taught. I think he was born in the USSR because he makes a few dark jokes about soviet-bloc countries...  The test was a ****, though.
